query_summary: The program likely contains an error in the second loop where it incorrectly evaluates the range and divisibility conditions using the last index instead of iterating through all elements.
oracle_summary: The second loop mistakenly uses the variable `i` (from the previous loop) instead of `j`, so it repeatedly checks the wrong index and fails to validate each element `S[j]`.

retrieved.summary: The buggy code incorrectly iterates from index 3 to 15 instead of from 0 to 15, leading to an "index out of range" error if the input string has fewer than 16 characters.
retrieved.diff:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -1,6 +1,6 @@
 s = input()
 ans = "Yes"
-for i in range(3,16):
+for i in range(16):
     if i %2 == 1 and s[i] != "0":
         ans = "No"
         break
